attributes.action: Keep the Epsom street community centre open for youth and family.
attributes.additional_details:
All we're asking from Nugent is that they fulfil their commitment as part of the asset transfer from Liverpool city council in 2015. This was for Epsom to remain Open Access Youth and Community play as a vital facility in Vauxhall. Part of the agreement with City council was to ensure the continuation of a safe and sustainable environment for the young people and family's of Vauxhall who rely on this Open Access centre. 
Please support our fight to keep the Epsom street centre open.
attributes.background: We've started this petition to ensure that this vital service of community youth and play stays in Epsom street (Lovingly known as the Epsy). This building has been the Epicentre of the community for over 4 generations.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is the responsibility of your local council. 

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You could start a new petition about something the UK Government and Parliament are responsible for. For example, you could start a new petition asking the UK Government and Parliament to provide more funding to local authorities for community centres if that's what you'd like to happen.
